captions.text:
Megatron has got Sam trapped inside that
warehouse

Now I  know your first instinct is
going to be to stay here
and let me go in and fight everyone by myself but what did I tell you...
I don't wanna find myself alone in the woods fighting 4 or 5 Decepticons to  turn around and see

you guys hiding in the bushes just
waiting to see what happens
I can't believe Optimus is dead.
If only we had another shard of the AllSpark like the one that was stolen and
I've had this one in my purse almost the whole time..
I said we all fight together!

I'm just saying if you can only be
beaten by a prime
and I just killed Optimus Prime earlier..
Then technically that makes me more powerful than you, doesn't it?
At last, we'll have revenge, right?
Yeah I'm glad we Autobots 'cause we never do anything offensive.
How 'bout you transform into a car and lickety split me over there instead?

You're all cars and you're
making me run on foot through the middle of a war zone!!
Here, take my parts and you will become the greatest Autobot
that everyone wishes you to be.
Kitten calendar, kitten calendar, kitten calendar.

comments.author: Micah Hoffman

comments.text:
It always bothered me how the human leads in this series are left 
defenseless in these big battles. It's like Sam said, they're robots that 
turn into cars and none of them could give him a lift protecting him from 
flying debris or explosives?!
At least in G1 the human companions had exo-armor that doubled as a mini 
vehicle with laser pistols built by the Autobots. It was more practical and 
realistic than the physics involved in Bay's Transformer movies.﻿

You know when i saw the first transformers movie i thought all the new 
transformer models (side from Starscream) were pretty cool looking. They 
are Transforming machines and it was cool to see the little bits and pieces 
come together to make this monstrous machine, but as the movies went on i 
started to miss the more simple animated style. I think the Trandformers 
should stay animated with there original images and this video just meks 
Michel Bays robots look even uglier. 

Anyone else agree? ﻿
